alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Henry; Mercer; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 7:31AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Rock Island, Mercer, southern Whiteside, Henry, and eastern Scott Counties through 830 AM CDT... At 730 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Port Byron to Alpha. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... East Moline, Kewanee, Cambridge, Silvis, Geneseo, Colona, Le Claire, Coal Valley, Galva, Hampton, Orion, Port Byron, Erie, Atkinson, Rapids City, Sheffield, Princeton, Annawan, Woodhull and Tampico. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 305 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 47. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 9 and 33. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for northwestern Illinois...and east central Iowa.

area.areaDesc: Bureau; Henry; Mercer; Rock Island; Whiteside
